As the starting quarterback, Joe Burrow will play a key role in the Bengals' success this season. He is the leader of the offense and responsible for making sure the team moves the ball down the field and scores points. His ability to read defenses, make accurate passes, and make good decisions under pressure will be critical in determining the team's success.

To improve upon his rookie year, Burrow can focus on several areas. First, he can work on developing better chemistry with his receivers and tight ends. This includes building timing and trust with them, as well as improving his accuracy on deep throws. Second, he can work on his pre-snap reads and adjustments, allowing him to get the offense into the best possible play based on the defense's alignment. Finally, he can work on his decision-making and not forcing throws into tight coverage, which led to some interceptions in his rookie season. With improvement in these areas, Burrow should be able to take his game to the next level and help the Bengals win more games.
